data_sources.data_quality_notes: Comprehensive research from official SCE sources, CPUC documents, and comparative PG&E OBMC program information

capacity_rate.notes: No monetary incentives for participation. Primary benefit is exemption from rotating outages.

performance_rate.notes: No performance payments. Penalty only: $6.00/kWh excess energy charge for non-compliance.

call_windows.notes: Events occur during CAISO Stage 3 emergencies when rotating outages are declared. Can occur any day including holidays and weekends.

customer_classes.size_threshold_notes: Eligible customers are those who can independently or in aggregate reduce their entire circuit's load by up to 15%, in increments of 5%

additional_requirements: Must file and obtain SCE approval of an OBMC Plan prior to participation
Must be able to reduce entire circuit load by up to 15% in 5% increments
Performance measured against prior year's same month average peak period load, adjusted for major facility changes
May require interval metering equipment (participant pays for additional metering if needed)

event_parameters.notes: CAISO rotating outages typically last one hour. Participants must reduce load for entire duration of every rotating outage.

notification_methods: SCE may have as little as 10 minutes notice after Stage 3 emergency declared
notification.notes: Limited notification time. SCE contacts media for broadcast. Participants must be prepared to curtail immediately when rotating outage begins.

event_triggers.trigger_description: Events are triggered when CAISO declares a Stage 3 electrical emergency and orders rotating outages. This occurs when operating reserves fall below 1.5-2.0% and load interruption is imminent or in progress.
event_triggers.primary_trigger: CAISO Stage 3 Emergency / Energy Emergency Alert Level 3 (EEA 3)
secondary_triggers: Operating reserves below minimum Contingency Reserve requirements

nomination_bidding.nomination_deadline: must submit and receive approval of OBMC Plan before participation
nomination_bidding.notes: Participants commit to fixed 15% circuit load reduction in 5% increments

penalties.penalty_structure: Excess energy charges of $6.00 per kWh for failure to achieve required circuit load reduction of up to 15%

baseline_methodology.calculation_method: Measured using a 10-day baseline excluding PG&E holidays and event days
baseline_methodology.notes: Optional 'Day-Of' adjustment allowed, capped at 20%. Performance measured against prior year's same month average peak period load, adjusted for major changes in facilities.

program_participation.enrollment_process: Contact SCE Account Representative or call Demand Response Help desk at 1-866-334-7827
program_participation.enrollment_deadline: must enroll and have approved plan before rotating outage season
program_participation.participation_limitations: May participate in other demand response programs with limitations (see tariff)

recent_events.description: First rotating outages in California in 19 years during heat wave
Second day of rotating outages during August 2020 heat emergency
CAISO declared EEA 3 but rotating outages were avoided through conservation

historical_events.notes: Rotating outages are rare. Program provides insurance against future grid emergencies. Last actual rotating outages were in August 2020.

integration_metadata.optimizer_notes: Not compatible with optimization models - events are mandatory and unpredictable. Serves as reliability/insurance program.
integration_metadata.notes: High-quality data from authoritative SCE and CPUC sources. Some gaps in notification procedures and precise event parameters. Program is well-documented but events are rare.

data_gaps: Exact notification method to OBMC participants

similar_programs: PG&E Schedule E-OBMC (similar structure, $6/kWh penalty, 15-minute response time)
SCE Emergency Load Reduction Program (ELRP) - different trigger and payment structure
unique_features: No monetary incentive - exemption from rotating outages is sole benefit
Requires entire circuit load reduction coordination
Mandatory participation in every rotating outage event
Based on 1980 CPUC Rotating Outage Program framework
